p: The S. pasteurii strain (BNCC 337394) used in this study was purchased from Bnbio (Beina Chuanglian Biotechnology Institute, Beijing). The whole genome sequencing results of this strain were uploaded to NCBI (NZ_CP038012.1) in March 2019 [ 21]. The received bacterial lyophilized powder was first activated with premade activation medium (tryptone 5g/L, yeast extract 3g/L, urea 20g/L, pH = 7.3) and incubated at 30°C for 24 hours. Then, the obtained small amount of bacterial culture was streaked onto Christensen’s Urea Agar [ 22] plate and grow at 30°C for 24 hours. A single colony with good growth potential was selected for expansion and subsequent studies. The medium was the NH 4-YE medium recommended by the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC).
